com.tombarrasso.android.wp7ui.view
Class WPContextMenu

java.lang.Object
  com.tombarrasso.android.wp7ui.view.WPContextMenu

public class WPContextMenu
extends java.lang.Object

Note: This current implementation will likely be removed/ completly redone soon and this class should not be used for future projects.
This is the class that manages our context menu items in a PopupWindow. It is essentially a styled ListView that is shown show(float), opened via a LongPress event. That event is triggered via Activity. To use this context menu, have your Activity extend WPActivity and invoke

Based on William J Francis's (w.j.francis@tx.rr.com) CustomMenu. http://www.codeproject.com/KB/android/AndroidMenusMyWay.aspx

Note: In order to vibrate when the context menu is displayed the VIBRATE permission must be declared in Manifest.xml. android.permission.VIBRATE

Since:
07-16-2011

onItemClick

public void onItemClick( parent,
                        View view,

Listener for when a ListItem was selected, notifies the context menu listener.

show

public void show(float y)
Display the context menu at the supplied y value. Uses currently set mMenuItems for what to display. Vibrates if shouldVibrate is true.

Parameters:
y - The absolute y value (relative to the screen) that the context menu should be draw. If y < 0 the menu will be displayed at the top of the screen.

onDismiss

public void onDismiss()
Triggered when mPopupWindow is dismissed. This is to ensure that if the window is canceled by unexpected means we clean up and allow it to return.

setVibrate

public void setVibrate(boolean vibrate)
Set whether or not Context Menu's should produce a vibration when it displays.

Parameters:
vibrate -

getY

public float getY()
Returns:
The last y coordinate to display the context menu at.

This setting controls whether or not the menu closes after an item is selected.

setShouldVibrate

Parameters:
vibrate - Whether or not the context menu should vibrate when show(float) is called.

setMenuItems

public void setMenuItems(java.util.ArrayList<WPMenuItem> items)
Use this method to assign your menu items. You can only call this when the menu is hidden.

addMenuItems

public void addMenuItems(int[] ids,
                         int[] strings)
ids and strings must be of the same length. ids[i] must correspond to strings[i].

Parameters:
ids - List of integer ids.
strings - List of string resource ids.

addMenuItems

public void addMenuItems(int[] ids,
                         java.lang.String[] strings)
Same as addMenuItems(int[], int[]) except you supply a list of strings instead of ids pointing to references of strings.

Parameters:
ids - List of integer ids.
strings - List of strings.

addMenuItems

public void addMenuItems(int[] ids,
                         int strs)
Another convenience method that allows you to add context menu items using an XML string array.

Parameters:
ids - List of integer ids.
strs - Reference to string resource array.
